msDesc.head: Gervase of Prémontré, Epistolae, with other letters of moral instruction, poems, and documents relating to the Premonstratensian order; England, 13th century, second half, with additions

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt capitula quarundum literarum abbatis cujusdam Præmonstratensis ecclesie
msItem.note: Table of contents, listing 105 items, ending with art. 8 below; then listing arts. 9-11 as unnumbered additions; other hands add on fol. 5v references to arts. 12-17. Fol. 6r-v blank. For fols. 7v-8v see below after art. 17.

msItem.rubric: Andreas, prior Præmonstratensis, de vera fraternitate, cuidam canonico ejusdem loci
Quod hiis diebus loquuntur homines de fabulis
msItem.incipit: Cogita, frater, quanta sit malicia dierum presentium
Rogavit me sepius tua mihi predilecta fraternitas

msItem.rubric: Instruitur magister curie specialiter [quomodo religiosus in curia debeat vivere]
msItem.incipit: Considerans mala mundi ad que nuper es adholescens emissus

msItem.rubric: Instruitur religiosus a religioso ad se custodiendum
msItem.incipit: Cum in anno preterito ad messes colligendas exisses

msItem.rubric: Que remedia valent contra insolencias carnis
msItem.incipit: Salutem. Terruerunt me plurimum litere quas misisti

msItem.author: Gervase of Prémontré
msItem.title: Epistolae
msItem.rubric: Quedam pars registri Gervasii abbatis Premonst.
msItem.note: See C. R. Cheney, 'Gervase, Abbot of Prémontré: A medieval letter writer', Bulletin of the John Rylands Library 33/1 (1950), 25-56. 101 letters, numbered vii-civ, xii bis, xxii bis, xxxvii bis. A folio missing between fos. 112-113 contained the latter part of the hundredth letter (ep. 99 in Hugo's numeration). As printed by Sacrœ Antiquitatis Monumentorum ed. C. L. Hugo (1725) but in different order, omitting nos. 1, 5-13, 30-32, 84, 87-94, 105-107, 115-137, and with twelve additional letters (six by Gervase) printed by Cheney, op. cit., 47-56.

msItem.rubric: Conquestio Randulfi de malicia horum dierum et temporis
msItem.note: 82 lines, with prologue
msItem.incipit: Si juxta mentis affectum mihi sermo suppeteret

Heu jam libet lacrimari, Et cum luctu lamentari, Dum sic mundum depravari Manifeste video; Legis vigor enervatur, Zelus recti minoratur, Immo prorsus adnullatur, Quem videre soleo. Dies sunt malorum, Dissolute vivitur, Et a pravis premitur Paucitas bonorum

msItem.rubric: Idem Randulphus, prior Premonst., de recordacione vite preterite
msItem.note: 60 lines.
msItem.incipit: Olim dum sophistica arte delectabar, Quicquit ipsa diceret verum opinabar, Summum scire seculi bonum suspicabar, Cecus in hiis frivolis cecos imitabar

msItem.note: 92 lines
msItem.incipit: Si vis bonus effici moribus et vita, Quicquit Deo displicet sollerter evita, Quicquit Ipse precipit facias, et ita Cum bonis angelica erit tibi vita

msItem.title: Metrical life of Thomas of Canterbury
msItem.rubric: Optimus rithmus in vita Sancti Thome martiris quondam Cantuar. archiepiscopi
msItem.note: Imperf. ad calcem.
As pr. Anecdota Bedæ, Lanfranci et aliorum, ed. J. A. Giles, 1851, p. 115ff
Folios missing; according to the table of contents they contained “De eleccione ven. archiepiscopi Ebor. Sewilli. De viii. miraculis Sancti Nicholai.”

msItem.rubric: De mandato Domini Guerrici, abbatis Præmonst., abbatibus quibusdam ut mitterent ei pecuniam
msItem.note: Ending only; dated at Newhouse (Neuhus) (Lincs.), 17 kal. Sept. 1273.

msItem.rubric: Abbas de Driburge rescribit negans pecuniam dari de ecclesiis non visitatis
msItem.note: Not dated.

msItem.rubric: Item de eadem materia rescribunt Abbas de Driburg et Pryor de Wyterne Domino Præmonstr., quia petit expensas ab ecclesiis non visitatis, et Johannes de Goly, canonicus de Driburg, deferens literas, in revertendo mortuus est
Requesting £5 from Dryburgh, £3 from Candida Casa (Whithorn), £2 from Alba Landa (Blanchland).
msItem.note: Not dated.

msItem.rubric: Item idem [Guerricus?] ad quendam canonicum suum
msItem.note: Not dated.
Commission from Guillermus, abbot of Premontre, and the general chapter, to the abbots of N[ewhouse], C[roxton], Sulby, Langley and Langdon, to visit the church of Bayham (Sussex).
Added texts
Letters from the abbots of Rievaulx, 'Bello' [Byland?], Fountains and Jervaulx, for "fr. John", sent by them to announce the deaths of monks. Dated at Rievaulx, 15 kal. Maii, 1315. .
Two letters from Roger de Northburgh, clerk, to the abbot and convent of St Agatha, Easby, seeking a pension for his clerk Thomas de Nova Haya, which Willielmus de Stranshale is about to resign.
Letter to the same (?), on the same subject (?), from William de Ayremynne.
Letter from Thomas, abbot of Jervaulx, to the abbot of S. (?St Agatha) seeking pardon for an injury done to the latter..
Letter from the abbots of Newhouse and Croxton to the abbots of St Agatha, Easby, and Coverham, commending fr. Elias, canon of Newhouse. Dated at Newhouse Pentecost 1319.
22 lines, added, 15th (?) century.

supportDesc.foliation: 1-135; first two and last two paper leaves unfoliated.
supportDesc.collation: A(3) (fols. 1-6), B(2) (fols. 7-8) , 1(8)-3(8) (fols. 9-32), 4(12)-9(12) (fols. 33-104), 10(12-1, 9 lost between fols. 112 and 113), 11(12) (fols. 116-127); fols. 128-135 uncertain. Catchwords; quires numbered on the final leaves.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in leadpoint (?) with double vertical bounding lines; typically 1 column of 21-22 lines; ruled space 117 68 ; written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Anglicana, mostly by one hand (except fols. 7v-8r, fols. 134v-135v).

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrics; initials in alternating red and blue.

binding.p: Stiff parchment binding with blind-ruled filleting.

origin.origDate: 13th century, second half, at least partly after 1273

recordHist.source: Description adapted by Matthew Holford (July 2022) from the Quarto Catalogue (W. D. Macray, Catalogi codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecæ Bodleianæ...viri munificentissimi Ricardi Rawlinson, J.C.D., codicum...complectens, Quarto Catalogues V, 5 fascicles, 1862–1900), with additional physical description and with reference to published literature as cited. Quarto Catalogue, col. 284 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 285–6 Quarto Catalogue, col. 287 Summary Catalogue, vol. 3, p. 215

revisionDesc.change: Description revised for publication on Digital Bodleian.
